application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Excavation to provide part extension and part reduction to existing basement to form habitable space and front lightwell; single storey side/rear extension (following part demolition of existing rear additions); alterations to front dormer; and installation of three rooflights to main side and rear roof slope.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawings:	1356.00, 1356.102, 1356.103, 1356.104, 1356.105, 1356.106, 1356.109, Heritage Statement, received 16.12.2020, 1356.110, received 01.03.2021, 1356.23b, 1356.25a, 1356.27b revised, 1356.29, 1356.30a, received 04.03.2021
REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the original dwellinghouse and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with the Bedford Park Conservation Area Management Plan (2007) and policies HC1 and D4 of The Publication London Plan (2021), 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B, 7C and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013).
| The proposed three rooflights to the side and rear elevations of the main roof shall be fitted with conservation-style rooflights.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies HC1 and D4 of The Publication London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
